A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The last Jedi is not a bad movie. But what critics don't seem to understand is that a good movie is not by any means a good Star Wars movie. I am a long time fan of the franchise and after seeing TLJ I just felt underwhelmed and shocked. The director wanted to surprise the audience by his new and bold direction but at what cost? Is surprising the audience really worth disappointing the fans that have kept this franchise alive for the past 40 years?
